Similar to all emotions, anger serves a purpose. It lets us know when we are distressed and can be mentally and physically discomfiting. Anger can also motivate us to address our underlying needs, desires, or perceived threats.  #Anger #SelfCompassion #SelfAwareness
Anger can give you a cortisol rush that makes you feel alive and energized. It can also help you avoid taking responsibility for your own decisions since anger is a way of blaming others for your suffering. #Anger #SelfCompassion #SelfAwareness
If you don't realize your anger is destructive, it would intensify over time. And you will express it in unhealthy ways at the expense of others. #Anger #SelfCompassion #SelfAwareness

The rewards for giving up the anger habit in your relationships are: 1. A calm mind,  2. A sense of freedom, 3. Better communication with another person 4. Release from the quest for power  #relationships #anger #couplesgoals #Love
Anger takes you farther and farther from your desire of an intimate and loving connection with one another.  #relationships #anger #couplesgoals #Love
Anger leads your relationships into a perpetual desire to either control or to escape control.  #relationships #anger #couplesgoals #Love
